classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with B3), B1-B5 elective, C1, C2, C3, C4, D1, D2, D4, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). One (1) course must be completed from B1, in addition to STAT 217. No ANT/GEOG class may be taken to fulfill GE D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D4, D5 or F.

The following courses can go here: ANT310, ANT311, ANT393, GEOG328, GEOG440
Any ANT Elective (300-400 level) can go here.
The following courses can go here: GEOG300, GEOG340, GEOG370, GEOG380
Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here.
Any GEOG Elective (300-400 level) can go here.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B & Upper-Division C should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units).
Any ANT Elective (300-400 level) can go here.

Select one of the following: BUS207, BUS409, BUS410, BUS473; CRP/NR 404; ES380; JOUR302; LS214; PHIL334; POLS295, POLS340, POLS342, POLS384, POLS386 or POLS387, POLS417, POLS426, POLS445, POLS457; PSY375; SOC402, SOC406, SOC412.

Consultation with faculty advisor is recommended. A total for 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward concentration requirements. No double-counting for major/concentration.
